problem_text: Model a sinusoidal function where amplitude represents inequality and midline represents basic access. Label clearly.
solution_text: f(t) = A sin(Bt) + M; Amplitude controls range of access, midline shifts entire system baseline.

problem_text: Change only the midline of your model. What effect does this have on your system’s outcomes?
solution_text: Midline change shifts all values up/down — increases baseline access or decreases opportunity range.

problem_text: In your model, a higher amplitude shows dramatic swings. What might cause this in society?
solution_text: Instability, crisis, under-regulated systems. Bigger swings = more unpredictability or fragility.
